tweets.content:
4/5 - Legacy User Benefits

The OG staking program and Surf V1 rewards will be fully inherited in the new version. Season 1 of the points system will officially end by tomorrow, 1/11/2025, and all points will be consolidated. At the proper time, and if deemed necessary, we will launch Season 2 to continue incentivizing user participation. Once PMF and real user scenarios are confirmed, we will swiftly roll out the TGE plan, ideally in parallel with our new chain launch.

Future Airdrop for OG Cards
Airdrops upon TGE for OG cards will be determined based on ownership of the cards rather than points accrued through staking NFTs. This ensures that long-term holders of OG cards are rewarded fairly and proportionally.
tweets.author: surf_protocol

tweets.content:
3/5 - Future Plans

Expanding Partnerships: Surf will focus on collaborating with more projects, bringing applications to their communities while attracting their users to the Surf ecosystem.

Market Ceiling: Hyperliquid has already set a benchmark for the on-chain perpetual trading sector. While there wonâ€™t be just one winner, the gap between projects with real user scenarios and those without will widen. Surfâ€™s model of aggregating multiple collateral types and communities positions it for differentiated competition, with a valuation target of no less than $2 billion.

Decentralization Path: To validate the product's feasibility and support projects across multiple chains, Surf has initially launched a centralized backend version as a beta. Once we see signs of real user adoption, we will quickly launch our dedicated trading chain, fully decentralizing the platform and adding significant value to future valuations.
tweets.author: surf_protocol

tweets.content:
2/5 - Surf V2 Overview

Our team believes Surf V2 is a product that has the potential to rival Hyperliquid. It stands out significantly from the hundreds of existing products and shows a high level of alignment with user needs, as confirmed through our interactions with users.

Product Model
Surf V2 empowers every partner project by enabling their tokens to:
Be used as liquidity provider (LP) assets;
Serve as collateral for opening positions.

Supported Trading Pairs
To ensure fairness for both LPs and traders, Surf V2 will initially support major trading pairs, such as BTC/USD and SOL/USD, where price discovery is more robust and liquidity is more stable.

When token holders make profits, they earn more tokens from the corresponding token pool. When they incur losses, their tokens flow into the pool. To put it simply, Surf V2 enables every project to run its own "casino."

For long-term token holders: They can act as the "house" by providing liquidity, earning stable returns with advantages far greater than traditional casinos (e.g., baccarat or blackjack).
For traders: It significantly enhances token utility by adding a new use case, improving capital efficiency.
For projects: Both LP and trading activities reduce token circulation, achieving a win-win-win scenario.

From Surf's Perspective
By collaborating with multiple projects, Surf can aggregate user traffic from various communities, creating synergies between projects and fostering network effects. Surf V2â€™s model combines the oracle-based betting mechanics popularized by DeFi projects like GMX and Jupiter with community-driven innovation, resulting in a highly differentiated product.
tweets.author: surf_protocol

tweets.content:
Recent Market Observations, Insights, and Surf Progress with V2 OverviewğŸ“œ

1/5 - Market Observations

The current bull market has a positive overall sentiment, but new projects are showing a clear polarization. Some projects with strong Product-Market Fit (PMF), such as Ethena and Hyperliquid, have gained significant market recognition, with valuations exceeding $10 billion. On the other hand, some projects that have not yet demonstrated a solid PMF treat token listings as their ultimate goal. These projects often end up with mediocre valuations of $10â€“20 million and continue to decline, even in a bull market.

Our team firmly believes that PMF is the prerequisite for token issuance. Only with a real application scenario can token issuance drive more users to adopt it. More users lead to greater token demand, forming a positive externality and a virtuous cycle. Without this, a rushed TGE (Token Generation Event) often accelerates a projectâ€™s collapse, resulting in losses for the team, investors, and community.

While some community members may focus on short-term gains, urging projects to issue tokens quickly for quick profits, even at minimal margins, we as project operators must consider the long-term health of the project. Our goal is not to settle for small and short-term gains but to create a phenomenon-level wealth effect. At TGE, we aim to achieve two outcomes:
High token valuation, so participants can profit;
Long-term holding value, ensuring that new buyers can benefit as well, instead of becoming "bag holders."

Observations on the Perpetual Contract Sector
The perpetual trading sector is one of the most competitive areas, with over 200 on-chain exchanges, based on our team's analysis. The downside of this intense competition is that most projects struggle to stand out. However, the upside is that projects like Hyperliquid, which manage to break through, gain significant attention and valuation.

Hyperliquid, for example, has achieved a fully diluted valuation (FDV) of $30 billion without external investors or listings on major exchanges. This demonstrates the power of PMF and how it can enable projects to succeed despite a crowded market.
